turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello there. It's uh Doctor <UNIN/> here. How can I help you this afternoon?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh, I just got a terrible headache since mid-day.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um on the left side. It's just making me feel so ill. <UNIN/> I just feel like I need to vomit.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that. Um can you tell me a bit more about the headache?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Well you know, I noticed some zig-zag lines in my vision a few minutes before the headache started.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: My vision blurred. Um, you know, it just

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I, yeah. Pain's just horrible. Just making me feel so unwell. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm, OK. And <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>  just want you to do something.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Well, let's try our best. Let's try and get you, let's try and get you well, soon. Um you mentioned it's on your left hand side. Is that right? And it started at mid-day, a few hours ago.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um did the pain come on quite suddenly? Or was it more of a gradual build up?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Don't know, really. It just happened.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And are you able to describe what kind of headache it was? For example, was it throbbing, or was it more of a sharp pain?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I guess it's, yeah I guess it's throbbing, um on that left side.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And is it moving anywhere else, at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, but it's worse when I move.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh OK. Is that when you move your neck?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Well, like if I lean forward, or like move my head or neck, yeah, headache gets worse.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm just really worried. Like I've just been googling and like I've read, <UNIN/> you know if your <UNIN/> headache gets worse if you move, it could be a sign of brain cancer.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Is that all you're worried about?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> cancer.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is that, is that all your main worries today?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh yeah, yeah and I'd like, you know

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: My, my friend's mum, she she recently died of a brain tumor. So, it's really concerning me actually.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Oh dear, I'm sorry to hear that. I can, I can understand why it's affecting you. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> why don't we, why don't we take a good history first, and let me examine you. And then we can have a little chat afterwards, and see what's going on here.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um so you mentioned a few things. You mentioned a headache. You also mentioned some disease, like Lyme's, uh before the headaches came on.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And your vision has been blurry as well. Is that right? Is that <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, is that on both eyes, or just in left, left eye?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Eh, feels like it <UNSURE>some days</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Both eyes, OK. Have you any difficulty with seeing bright lights, at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah well I'm <UNIN/>, wearing sunglasses right now. It's just, you know, the light's really hurting my eyes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Ohh, I see OK. Um and you mentioned that you felt quite nauseous. Have you vomited at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I vomited twice.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Twice, OK.  Um <UNIN/> earlier today, OK. Um, any temperatures or fevers?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no I don't feel feverish.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, any other funny skin rashes that you may have noticed?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I haven't noticed anything like that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um fine. Um, and do you normally get headaches?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I'm not really prone to them, no. No but I did, I did have a similar headache a few weeks ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And what happened then?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Just </UNSURE> similar.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How long did it last for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Couple of days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Did you do anything that made it better?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um yeah I had to take painkillers, and had to go go to bed and rest and

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> couple days off work, and I work in the fashion industry. And you know, they're wondering what's going on, like I have to take sick days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I need to get back to work today. But you know, what if it is a brain tumour? What's gonna happen with my future and my career?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: You know, <UNIN/> really <UNIN/> about this. <UNIN/> never had headaches like this before. Like why should I get them now?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, sure. I mean I can see your concern obviously is a lot, there's a lot of worry there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um but you know let let let, as I said let's take it step by step, um to see exactly what the cause of these headaches are first. Um, I'm just going to ask you some, um very uh yes no questions if that's OK, ma'am. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um have you noticed any problems with your speech at all, any difficulties with your words?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Any problems with your arms and legs? For example numbness or weakness?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Any difficulty with balance, your balance or coordination?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And have you had any injuries to your head? Have you had a fall recently, or been knocked on the head?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. Um and and you're feeling otherwise OK. So, for example your um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh your your breathing's OK? You're not feeling breathless, or

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Um do you have any other medical history I should be aware of?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, <UNSURE>nothing</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No. So for example, have you had, has anyone told you you've had migraines in the past?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Do you <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No. My mum, my mum has, has migraines. But I've, I've not been diagnosed.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, <UNIN/> my next question was that of family history. Is there anything in the family? So apart from migraines, is there anything else? Is there anything related to brain, for example?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What was that, sorry?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: My mom has an underactive thyroid as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> <UNSURE>thyroid </UNSURE> as well. OK. Um OK any other problems with for example, the brain, or? Um you mentioned brain cancer. Any other family history of <UNIN/>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Um in terms of medications, do you take anything on a regular basis?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um I take the pill, Microgynon.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And how long have you been on that for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> three months.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Three months, OK. And is that mainly for contraception, or is that for something else?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> it's for contraception.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's something you meant to have a little discussion about today as well. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh well my next question was about um your social, your situation at home. You mentioned you work in the fashion industry.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And your work, is your job quite stressful at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah it's really stressful, actually.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Have you been</UNSURE>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> having problems at like <UNIN/> work, you know managers like putting a lot of pressure on me to deliver and, uh yeah it's not a good time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>. Is it getting you down?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I don't feel down, just a little bit stressed.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. And what kind of things do you do to alleviate your stress, normally?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Nothing really.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you do much in the way of exercise?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Um who's at home with you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I live on my own.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um are you coping OK at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah? OK. Um do you smoke at all? <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> and do you drink much in the way of alcohol?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. Um, so normally at this <UNIN/> I'd like to kind of proceed to examination. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's um <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> based on your story, um I wonder whether you may, uh may have a migraine, uh <UNIN/> migraine type headache. Uh it sounds

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, very classical of that, of that nature, the the the <UNIN/> headache on one side, throbbing nature, the nausea, vomiting, um sensitivity to bright lights.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, I'm reassured that you don't have anything more serious, such as meningitis, or indeed

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Brain cancer, I know that was a big worry of yours initially. <UNSURE>Um</UNSURE>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> thank you, <UNIN/> uh thanks so much. I was so worried that I had cancer. And, ohh now you say migraine. Yeah I guess my mum has similar symptoms to me and yeah, it does make sense.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> yeah. Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Well, I hope that puts your, you know, <UNIN/> mind at ease. Um, certainly this is the second migraine you've had in the space of a month. Um,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So I think, moving forwards, there's a couple of options. I think keeping a headache diary would be quite important, uh to see exactly what's triggering these headaches.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And in terms of trying to treat your headaches today, some strong painkillers would be advisable. So, <UNIN/> think about Paracetamol, or even Co-codamol.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and some anti-inflammatories, such as Ibuprofen and Naproxen. How's that sound to you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: K that sounds good.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um and uh, you know if your headaches were to become more persistent, then we could maybe think about giving you some medications that will stop your headaches from happening in the first place, something <UNIN/> prophylactic medicines.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> then we could have a discussion next time I see you next week, perhaps.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, now a couple of things I want you to think about is, you know if your symptoms aren't getting better next two three days, or indeed they're getting worse.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'd like you to come back and see me, um straight away if possible. So if your headache's getting worse, not responding to medications

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Or your um neck pain is getting worse, or you develop any weakness in your arms and legs, or your vision, then I want you to come back and see me straight away. OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Does that sound <UNIN/> all OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Doctor, that's great.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Great. Any questions for me?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No. Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Have a good day!

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: K thanks. Bye!

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right.
